message:
Some good news for Israel from the World Health Organization (of the United Nations):

An Israeli physician, Dr. Asher Shalmon, was appointed a member of the organization's executive committee.
Beyond that, the organization approved a resolution condemning Hamas's military use of medical facilities such as hospitals and clinics as well as ambulances.
The call for the unconditional release of the Israeli abductees in Gaza was also accepted, recognizing that they do not receive any of the rights they deserve.

##
It may sound trivial to you, but the ratification of such a decision by one of the UN agencies (which is always biased against Israel) is a real achievement that could help Israel in the legal arena, especially with regard to the targeting of operatives and terrorist activity in medical facilities across the Strip.
Police make an arrest in the Temple Mount area a short time ago.

Iranian President Raisi's personal belongings found in the crashed helicopter: blackened rings and a "mehr" - a prayer stone made of clay that Raisi placed in front of him during the prayer (the Shiites usually press their foreheads to "mehr" while kneeling on the ground).

The military spokesman of the Houthis:
We responded to the American-British attack tonight in Yemen by firing ballistic missiles at the American aircraft carrier
Dwight Eisenhower.
We hit the target accurately.

The American attack killed 16 and injured 41, including civilians.
More documentation from Jabaliya following the withdrawal of the IDF
Palestinian channels: After the withdrawal of IDF forces from Jabaliya, they return to the camp (in the north of the Strip) which looks as if it was hit by an earthquake.

Hezbollah: We attacked the Iron Dome batteries in Zaura using suicide drones. We hit the target.

IDF: Following the sirens that sounded earlier today regarding a hostile aircraft infiltration in northern Israel, two explosive UAVs that crossed from Lebanon fell in the Zaura area in the northern Golan Heights. No injuries were reported and the incident is under review. 

In addition, earlier today one launch from Lebanon toward the area of Metula fell in an open area, no injuries or damage were reported. The IDF struck the source of the fire. 

Following the sirens that sounded a short while ago in the Metula area and in the past hour in the Qela area regarding a hostile aircraft infiltration, it was determined to be a false identification.
Northern Gaza Strip: The movement of Gazans out of Beit Hanoun following the instructions 👆 of the IDF calling them to move to the west of Gaza City.

Ismail Haniyeh, Chairman of the Political Bureau of Hamas, in a speech at the 33rd Arab National Conference in Beirut (apparently his appearance is only via video - AA):

1. "Tufan Al-Aqsa" raised the occupation of the Palestinian issue to an unprecedented level that opened the door to the recognition of a Palestinian state.

2. In order to realize the liberation of Palestine and the return, elections must be held for the Palestinian presidency, the Legislative Council and the Palestinian National Council (the Palestinian National Council which is actually the parliament of the PLO organization, to which most of the Palestinian factions, except for Hamas, belong -AA) must be held.

3. A government of Palestinian national consensus must be established in the West Bank and the Gaza Strip.

4. We must continue to oppose normalization moves with Israel.

The Russian Ministry of Defense: In Israel's latest attack in Syria yesterday👆, Israel used an ADM-160 MALD aircraft designed to deceive air defense systems.
According to the Russians, Israel launched it at the same time as the Spice 1000 missile, but had to attack again later, because according to the Russian Ministry of Defense, the first attack was unsuccessful.

Official Iranian media:

Ali Larijani submitted his candidacy for the Iranian presidential elections this morning.

Larijani's candidacy is not surprising👆 He wanted to run for president against Raisi in 2021 but was blocked (by the big boss) so as not to harm Raisi's chance, who was the favorite in terms of Iran's supreme leader.
Larijani served for 12 years as the Speaker of the Iranian Parliament (2008-2020), a powerful and significant position in Iran, which is a stepping stone to more senior positions.
Larijani also served in the past (until 2007) as the chairman of the Iranian National Assembly and the subject of the negotiations on the nuclear agreement with the West is well known to him.

He is definitely a contender with high chances of winning.

The Ministry of Health of the Houthis in Yemen:

We condemn the American-British attack tonight that targeted civilian sites in Hodeidah province.

The intentional and illegal killings carried out by the planes as part of the British-American-Zionist aggression are war crimes!
These crimes constitute a violation of international law.
The number of dead in the attack is 16 and there are another 30 wounded. Due to the severity of the condition of the injured, the number of dead is expected to rise.

##
I want to express my concern that the Americans did not present organized plans for the evacuation of the population in Hodeidah prior to the attack. I expect a quick and transparent investigation. I am disturbed by the loss of innocent civilian lives in Yemen...

The IDF spokesperson confirms: the operation in Jabaliya is over.
According to the IDF spokesperson, as part of the operation in Jabaliya, hundreds of terrorists were killed and tunnels more than ten kilometers long were destroyed.
Among the achievements of the operation - the recovery of the bodies of the 7 abductees and their repatriation for burial in Israel.

The Palestinians report that this morning the IDF dispersed leaflets in the area of ​​Beit Hanoun in the north of the Gaza Strip where those staying at the schools in blocks 577-578 are called to evacuate to the south, to the western area of ​​Gaza City.

Nikki Haley at the Western Wall.

Photo credit: The Western Wall Heritage Foundation.

Members of Al-Aqsa Martyrs' Battalions (AMB) in Tulkarm se to be upset that people doubt their claims 👆 regarding the infiltration of the Israeli town of Bat Hefer and published a video of an M-16 (with a close-up on its serial number) claiming it to be the rifle which they allegedly took from an "officer's house" during their supposed infiltration.

It's worth noting that several days ago the AMB militants claimed to have taken an M-4 rifle, now they're presenting an M-16. They also claimed that they took a Glock pistol, which for some reason wasn't featured in the video. There seem to be quite a few inconsistencies in the Palestinian claims.

Hamas-affiliated sources claim: The explosions that rocked Gaza City last night and made the residents think it was an earthquake were a controlled explosion carried out by the Israeli forces in a residential complex in the north of the Gaza Strip.

Yemeni media reports 14 dead and 30 wounded (including civilians) in an American-British attack tonight in the port city of Hodeidah and the a-Salif area, in western Yemen.

According to the report, the government building and the Broadcasting Authority building in Hodeidah were targeted.

###
Let's hope no innocent civilians were killed... I'm sure an investigation will be conducted and everything will be presented transparently if so.

Al-Jazeera: The IDF withdrew from the Jabaliya "refugee camp" in the northern Gaza Strip after a military operation there that lasted 20 days.

In addition, al-Jazeera reports that the IDF has also withdrawn from Beit Lahia, Beit Hanoun, and the rest of the places where it operated in the north of the Gaza Strip.

##
The IDF spokesman has not yet issued an official statement on the matter.

The Palestinians report three casualties this morning, all members of the Darwish family, in an attack on a vehicle in the Nuseirat "refugee camp" in the center of the Gaza Strip.

According to the Palestinians, the three were responsible for managing humanitarian aid that entered the Strip.

The Palestinians additionally also report nine casualties in the attack on the home of the Abu Zahadi al-Sous family in block 9 of the Al-Buriej "refugee camp" in the center of the Gaza Strip, last night.

The IDF spokesman announced this morning the death of Adar Gavriel from the Bislah brigade (828), and a soldier in the Givati Brigade in battles in the north of the Gaza Strip and in the south.

May their memory be a blessing.
Gaza City residents reported shortly after midnight last night that they experienced an "earthquake" - now they claim that it was Israeli bunker-penetrating missiles.

Trump's "hush money" trial:
Trump was found guilty of all 34 counts for which he was indicted.

Trump reacted to the verdict: it was an rigged trial, a disgrace... The real verdict will be given on November 5th, by the people.

###
In terms of his new legal situation - Trump's conviction does not prevent him from running in the upcoming elections, but it might hurt his public image and thus lower his chances of winning.

Trump accuses the Democrats of this being a political trial. According to some commentators, the conviction can actually help him in the eyes of his voters, who might see the outcome of the trial as political persecution and a witch hunt.
